page.title: 10The Princess Royal Hospital
page.content: We interviewed Mr Halling, the unit administrator of the Princess Royal{ {Hospital}which is part of the Hull{ {Health}Authority. The{hospital}is 65 years old and changed name in 1983 to avoid confusion with the Hull Royal {Hospital}in west Hull. The 560 staff include service suppliers,and medical administrators, who run this 208 bed{hospital}at a cost of over Â£6million per year. The 8 ward{hospital}specializes in Gynaecology, Nephrology, Urology, Oncology and Radiotherapy. The four operating theatres perform up to 16 major cases per day. The{patients}are mainly adults and from the local area. Nearly 200,000 items of clothing are washed per week but not on site. They use{computers}for medical records, supplies department, wages and in the Dispensary.
